intro: Critesion turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, elongated fruits containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
